meanings.definition: A book with a series of pictures that vary gradually from one page to the next, so that when the pages are turned rapidly, the pictures appear to animate.
meanings.sent1: I made a flipbook of a stick figure dancing.
meanings.sent2: She showed her friends the flipbook of her cat chasing a butterfly.
meanings.sent3: The flipbook of a smiling sun made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His flipbook of a growing tree was like watching time speed up.
meanings.sent5: The flipbook of a jumping frog was so lifelike.

meanings.definition: To create an animation by rapidly flipping through a series of pictures in a flipbook.
meanings.sent1: He loves to flipbook his doodles to see them move.
meanings.sent2: They flipbooked the drawings to make a funny story.
meanings.sent3: She decided to flipbook her vacation photos for fun.
meanings.sent4: The artist flipbooked the sketches into a mesmerizing sequence.
meanings.sent5: We can flipbook the images to make a short film.

meanings.definition: A small book with a series of pictures that can be flipped through quickly to create the illusion of movement.
meanings.sent1: The kids were amazed by the flipbook of a running cheetah.
meanings.sent2: He carried a flipbook of his drawings everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The flipbook of a flying bird seemed to come to life.
meanings.sent4: Her flipbook of a waving flag caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The flipbook of a falling leaf was so calming.
